093_faceless.description: Faceless are demons of murder, summoned by ritual and bound to a worldy anchor by its summoner. Faceless tirelessly hunt their prey, unhindered by locks, guards or castle walls. Despite acting independently, each Faceless is an aspect of a greater demonic entity, either unable or unwilling to leave its home plane. This makes Faceless all the more terrifying, as a designated victim oftentimes finds itself harried by a neverending stream of demonic incursions until it finally succumbs to the continuous assaults. A creature targeted by the Faceless can only hope for the summoner's death or to evade its own demise long enough to wear out the patience of the demon.
093_faceless.name: Faceless

094_skeletal_sapper.description: Skeletal Sappers were devised by the Bonemason Pioneers of the Burial Host. Sappers are driven towards fortified settlements to tear holes into their defenses, allowing the rest to advance through the ruined fortifications. These tactics were quickly adopted by ambitious necromancers and ossian artisans throughout the realms.
094_skeletal_sapper.name: Skeletal Sapper

095_auxiliary_automaton_1.description: Auxiliary Automata are the next evolutionary step within the field of techno-arcane developments. It is outfitted with an advanced crystalline logic core that allows it to make decisions within a pre-defined perimeter, a sturdy chassis able to withstand considerable damage and gravity defying hover-generators, allowing it to navigate difficult terrain with ease. These prototypes are bristling with experimental weaponry and are designed for boarding actions within the tight confines of Airship corridors, being able to block off parts of the ship with geomantic hard-light barriers or act as a spearhead to breach fortified positions.
095_auxiliary_automaton_1.name: Auxiliary Automaton

095_auxiliary_automaton_2.description: Auxiliary Automata are the next evolutionary step within the field of techno-arcane developments. It is outfitted with an advanced crystalline logic core that allows it to make decisions within a pre-defined perimeter, a sturdy chassis able to withstand considerable damage and gravity defying hover-generators, allowing it to navigate difficult terrain with ease. These prototypes are bristling with experimental weaponry and are designed for boarding actions within the tight confines of Airship corridors, being able to block off parts of the ship with geomantic hard-light barriers or act as a spearhead to breach fortified positions.
095_auxiliary_automaton_2.name: Auxiliary Automaton

096_coastal_marauder_1.description: Marauders rely on speed and the element of surprise to overun less fortified and sparsely defended targets like coastal hamlets or monasteries. If met with resistance, the momentum of the attack needs to be upheld at any cost. Independed veteran war bands split off from the main force to hunt down enemy clusters before they can mount an organized defense. As houses go up in flames, the thick smoke covers the retreat back to the ship and onto the open sea..
096_coastal_marauder_1.name: Coastal Marauder

096_coastal_marauder_2.description: Marauders rely on speed and the element of surprise to overun less fortified and sparsely defended targets like coastal hamlets or monasteries. 096_coastal_marauder_3.name: Coastal Marauder

096_stormwrath_marauder.description: Stormwrath Marauders are conduits of the tempest’s fury, their heart beating in tact with the rolling thunder. Warriors might be born blessed by the storms or elevated by a higher being that holds command over the elements, such as a Storm Giant, a dragon or even a god. They become chosen warriors, stalwart in their faith and honoured keepers of the naval rites..
096_stormwrath_marauder.name: Stormwrath Marauder

097_hoplite_1.description: Heavy infantry fighting in unison, shield to shield and with their spears raised they stand against onrushing waves of attackers - regardless the setting, Hoplites fighting in phalanx formation are a powerful image to evoke. As it took more than two thousand years to dethrone the phalanx as the most effective method of ancient warfare, one has to wonder how how effective it might be in a fantasy setting, supported by magic or divine powers.
097_hoplite_1.name: Hoplite

097_hoplite_2.description: Heavy infantry fighting in unison, shield to shield and with their spears raised they stand against onrushing waves of attackers - regardless the setting, Hoplites fighting in phalanx formation are a powerful image to evoke. As it took more than two thousand years to dethrone the phalanx as the most effective method of ancient warfare, one has to wonder how how effective it might be in a fantasy setting, supported by magic or divine powers.
097_hoplite_2.name: Hoplite

097_hoplite_3.description: Heavy infantry fighting in unison, shield to shield and with their spears raised they stand against onrushing waves of attackers - regardless the setting, Hoplites fighting in phalanx formation are a powerful image to evoke. As it took more than two thousand years to dethrone the phalanx as the most effective method of ancient warfare, one has to wonder how how effective it might be in a fantasy setting, supported by magic or divine powers.
097_hoplite_3.name: Hoplite

097_hoplite_4.name: Hoplite

098_knight_of_tragedy.description: Collapsed under the weight of their oaths, these fallen Knights are bound to ruined castles or abandoned chapels. Some sold their souls to protect their brethren, transgressed against their patron saint or broke their oath so severly that it resulted in the total corruption of their being. Whatever the reason for their downfall, these erstwhile epitomes of piety and righteousness have become dark mirrors of their past, now doomed to cause the same pain and suffering they were once sworn to fight. Steeped in tragedy, these Knights are solemn creatures, most harboring the secret desire to die in combat, being finally brought to justice by a righteous blade.
098_knight_of_tragedy.name: Knight Of Tragedy

099_shipbreaker_leviathan.description: Exhibiting highly aggressive behaviour towards sea vessels, this leviathan class monstrosity of proto-reptilian heritage earned the designation “Shipbreaker”. An sentient oceanic predator of terrifying size, the Shipbreaker Leviathan hunts aquatic megafauna, its domain extending from the wave-crested open waters to the crushing hadopelagic depths. Sightings of wounded or slain specimen covered in scars and bitemarks allow a glimpse into the nightmarish realm of the oceanic void, where not even Leviathans are safe from being preyed upon.
099_shipbreaker_leviathan.name: Shipbreaker Leviathan

100_luck_dragon_1.description: In stark contrast to their domineering and tyrannical brethren, these travel sized dragons usually prefer a friendly scratch behind the ears to worship and subjugation. They do not take themselves very seriously and admire this quality in others, known to both form strong bonds of friendship, as well as petty, but well-spirited rivalries. It is unclear if the Luck Dragon's existence implies the existence of a Bad Luck Dragon, but experts argue that regular Dragons could already be considered Bad Luck Dragons.
100_luck_dragon_1.name: Luck Dragon

100_luck_dragon_2.description: In stark contrast to their domineering and tyrannical brethren, these travel sized dragons usually prefer a friendly scratch behind the ears to worship and subjugation. 101_stonegorger.description: Stonegorgers are an enigmatic offshoot of giant-kin, lacking the majesty and grandeur of their mythical brethren. Called Skoldbærer in their native tongue, fables claim that Stonegorgers devour rock and stone to get to the gems, ores and minerals within in an attempt to reunite their earthen mother with her treasures. Accumulating these precious materials within their bodies, they slowly turn into stone themselves. As they approach the end of their life, they seek ever greater depths, finally succumbing to age and pressure, returning earth’s treasures to its womb. The earth welcomes its wayward children back and gracefully accepts the gifts they bring, rewarding the Stonegorger by slowly turning it into a being of pure diamond, in death finally achieving the beauty it always pursued.
101_stonegorger.name: Stonegorger

102_gatebreaker_devil.description: Lacking the subtleness of their more devious kin, Gatebreaker Devils are part of the infernal vanguard, leading the charge upon the event of an incursion, as they charge through the brimstone gates and trample anything in their way. Eager to inflict wrath and violence upon the world, they are often called upon by Diabolists and Summoners to enact violence in their service. As they are lesser devils in that sense that they merely represent an aspect of a sin, rather than holding command over it, they are less likely to intentionally try and corrupt their temporary master.
102_gatebreaker_devil.name: Gatebreaker Devil

103_gloomspore_harvester.description: Gloomspore Harvesters haunt jungles and fungus forests, swamps, subterran groves and even occasionally overgrown City sewers. In dim light, their gaunt upper body resembles a scrawny tree, while it gently shifts its weight between its branch-like six legs, allowing it to silently stride through thick underbrush, as well as crawl-climb through the tree tops. A gentle rain of soft-glowing spores surrounds it, allowing the Harvester to sense its surroundings and infesting living creatures. Each infested creature appears as a radiant beacon to the Harvester, who in turn skulks towards it to harvest its weakened prey's dwindling energy.
103_gloomspore_harvester.name: Gloomspore Harvester

104_bone_host.description: A Bone Host is no single demon, rather a tendril of a multifacteded demonic swarm-being inhabiting one of several host bodies of gnarled bone. This demonic consciousness, resembling a shoal of abyssal energy, is spread over several Bone Hosts, fighting and hunting together in fiendish synchroniCity..
104_bone_host.name: Bone Host

000_month_1_bone_hag_1.description: Bone Hags abhor civilization’s ever expanding need for greater cities and more farmland.They regard each village as nothing but a malign growth with the potential to mutate into a tumorous City if left unchecked. As they draw strength from their bindings to the bones of the earth, the very essence of the primordial titans who gave up their bodies to create room for earthbound life, they require earth and stone untouched by tools or stonecraft, violently subduing any outside attempts to encroach on their domains.
000_month_1_bone_hag_1.name: Bone Hag

000_month_1_bone_hag_2.description: Bone Hags abhor civilization’s ever expanding need for greater cities and more farmland.They regard each village as nothing but a malign growth with the potential to mutate into a tumorous City if left unchecked. As they draw strength from their bindings to the bones of the earth, the very essence of the primordial titans who gave up their bodies to create room for earthbound life, they require earth and stone untouched by tools or stonecraft, violently subduing any outside attempts to encroach on their domains.
000_month_1_bone_hag_2.name: Bone Hag

105_ogre_mercenary.description: Better armed and more intelligent than their more feral brethren, these hulking henchmen are still known for their insatiable appetite for treasure and their considerable strength, making them a force to be reckoned with. Beneath their brutish exterior lies a mischievous sense of humor that often catches their victims off-guard.
105_ogre_mercenary.name: Ogre Mercenary

106_equiterrean.description: Equiterreans resemble horses carved from mossy rock, decked with a coat of rich earthy tones, adorned with vibrant greenery and blooming flowers. They are stalwart and gentle beings, channeling the lifegiving powers of earth and sun, mending wounds and restoring vigor. Loyal servants to those having dominion over the earthen aspect of the elemental spheres are often bestowed with such a steed as a boon, but Equiterreans may also choose to accept a worthy being as their rider themselves.
106_equiterrean.name: Equiterrean

107_trained_mage_1.description: Trained Mages are not only gifted with arcane potential, but have already taken steps to hone and further develop it. Their stern gaze tells of years of intense study, their confidence of their ability to bend reality to their will. They know what power they hold, what they sacrificed to aquire it and have already set their eyes on gaining more.
107_trained_mage_1.name: Trained Mage

107_trained_mage_2.description: Trained Mages are not only gifted with arcane potential, but have already taken steps to hone and further develop it. Their stern gaze tells of years of intense study, their confidence of their ability to bend reality to their will. They know what power they hold, what they sacrificed to aquire it and have already set their eyes on gaining more.

108_deathrite_harrower_1.description: The Deathrite Cult strives for a world silenced by death, an unliving utopia of crypts tended to by the mute Gravewardens. To hush those living beings disturbing the sacred silence of the Deathshroud, the Deathrite’s High Crematorians dispatch legions of thralls, both mortal cultists and the Annointed, undead beings bound or birthed into the ranks of the Deathrite. Among these Annointed are the Deathrite Harrowers, hateful souls that gave their life in service of the Deathrite, now carrying a holy mandate to silence the blasphemous beating of hearts and turn all that is living into blessed ash.
108_deathrite_harrower_1.name: Deathrite Harrower

108_deathrite_harrower_2.description: The Deathrite Cult strives for a world silenced by death, an unliving utopia of crypts tended to by the mute Gravewardens. To hush those living beings disturbing the sacred silence of the Deathshroud, the Deathrite’s High Crematorians dispatch legions of thralls, both mortal cultists and the Annointed, undead beings bound or birthed into the ranks of the Deathrite. Among these Annointed are the Deathrite Harrowers, hateful souls that gave their life in service of the Deathrite, now carrying a holy mandate to silence the blasphemous beating of hearts and turn all that is living into blessed ash.
108_deathrite_harrower_2.name: Deathrite Harrower

109_henge_guardian_1.description: Henge Guardians are ancient constructs carved by shamans from blessed rock, acting as arbiters of peace and bulwarks against intruders from beyond the veil of the mundane world. Within the Guardian reside ancestral spirits of ages past, souls of chiefs, warriors, shamans or figures of importance to the tribesfolk, empowering the towering stonework of their collective body with the desire to protect their kin and continually serve the tribe in death.
109_henge_guardian_1.name: Henge Guardian

109_henge_guardian_2.description: Henge Guardians are ancient constructs carved by shamans from blessed rock, acting as arbiters of peace and bulwarks against intruders from beyond the veil of the mundane world. Within the Guardian reside ancestral spirits of ages past, souls of chiefs, warriors, shamans or figures of importance to the tribesfolk, empowering the towering stonework of their collective body with the desire to protect their kin and continually serve the tribe in death.

110_apshait_ambusher.description: Apshait are named after mythical insects said to feast on the souls of the dead during their travels through the underworld. Those worrying about their immortal soul may be relieved to hear that the actual Apshait much prefer to feast on mortal bodies instead, making them a dangerous prospect for both lone travelers or armed transports traversing infested landscapes. Breeding in looming underground hives, the Asphait’s expansive tunnel networks stretch far beyond the central hive chambers, where the Apshait soldier swarms utilize them to coordinate intricate ambushes.
110_apshait_ambusher.name: Apshait Ambusher

111_aerocyte_floatling_1.description: Without warning, Aerocyte Floatlings descend from the high heavens, graceful like jellyfish slow-dancing on mistral currents. Awe quickly turns into horror as these Airborne parasites attach to organic hosts and begin to inflate, eventually carrying their prey off into the sky. There the bulbous Stratohives float, waiting for their Floatlings to deliver sustenance. Once the hulking specimens have drained the hosts of all biomass, the Floatlings attach to their Stratohive, receiving their equal share. When continuously fed, Floatlings evolve into Stratohive, becoming the host for their own flottilla of Floatlings and beginning the cycle a new.
111_aerocyte_floatling_1.name: Aerocyte Floatling

000_month_3_valkyrie.description: The Valkyrie’s purpose transcends mere escorts of the fallen, for they are seekers of the Allfather’s mightiest foes across all realms. Traversing the boundless expanse of countless worlds, they remain unyielding in their quest, the relentless pursuit of proving their mettle, that they may someday prove skillful enough to perceive the skeins of fate, recognizing warriors worthy of a place within the golden halls of heroism. Forged in the fires of battle and beaten into shape upon the anvil of her expectations, there are no greater warriors than those growing under the winged shadow of the Allfather’s champions.
000_month_3_valkyrie.name: Valkyrie

112_witherflesh_colossus_2.description: First created by the expert Fleshgrafters of the Burial Host, an endless column of shambling undead pressed into service by a council of arcane artisans with special interest in the possibilities offered by a staunch rejection of morality and ethics, the Witherflesh Colossi quickly became a staple in the arsenal of aspiring necromancers due to their hulking size, unearthly strength and customizable number of tearing, smashing and crushing limbs. While requiring a considerable starting investment of both necromantic energy and dead meat, the results speak for themselves and an expertly grafted Colossus is worth its weight in (albeit often blood-stained) gold.
112_witherflesh_colossus_2.name: Witherflesh Colossus

113_facestealer_1.description: Facestealers are demonic entities that revel in subjecting indiscriminate terror upon mortal beings. Their bulbous insectoid bodies are overgrown with faces and skulls in various states of decomposition, weeping, whispering, laughing or screaming. These are the results of the Facestealer’s unique hunting methods, being able to draw creatures into a demonic realm where they are assailed by the Imprisoned Ones, waning shades of the demon’s previous victims. If a creature succumbs to the demonic realm, its soul will be devoured by the Facestealer and its face joins the ingrown gallery upon the demon’s bloated body.
113_facestealer_1.name: Facestealer

113_imprisoned_one_1.description: The Imprisoned Ones are the echoes of a Facestealer’s victims populating the demonic realm lorded over by the demon. Waning shades of past beings consumed by the demonic energies of their captor, they have become part of the insidious process that once claimed their soul.
113_imprisoned_one_1.name: Imprisoned One

114_minotaur_2.description: For ages, scholars have been contemplating the origin of the mighty Minotaurs, bovine man-beasts of considerable strength, often exhibiting an inborn lust for battle and an innate understanding of ancient martial traditions. While civilized Minotaurs can be found in the ranks or even upper brass of mercenary bands or royal armies, feral specimens plague untamed lands or cut bloody swathes through frontier regions. Regardless of if they are the cursed children of a bestial progenitor or the products of a war god’s special kind of divine intervention, Minotaurs embody mythical prowess in a way few creatures do.
114_minotaur_2.name: Minotaur

114_minotaur_1.description: For ages, scholars have been contemplating the origin of the mighty Minotaurs, bovine man-beasts of considerable strength, often exhibiting an inborn lust for battle and an innate understanding of ancient martial traditions. 114_minotaur_1.name: Minotaur

000_month_2_magma_wyrm.description: Magma Wyrms inhabit the most inhospitable terrain imaginable, breeding at the black sand shores of great lava lakes or within the noxious calderas of active volcanoes. Glowing red with inner heat and covered in glistening obdsidan scales, fighting these great Wyrms head on is foolhardy bordering suicidal and only the greatest (or most boastful) dwarven heros are said to having defied a Wyrm’s withering heat and extinguished its molten core.
000_month_2_magma_wyrm.name: Magma Wyrm

115_pirate_powder_dancer_1.description: Powder Dancers are part of a pirate ship’s dedicated boarding crews, agile and tactically versatile fighters and marksmen well versed in the art of ship to ship combat. They constantly alternate between Melee and ranged weaponry, overwhelming the defenders with devastating point blank salvos from their characteristic flintlock pistols or pressuring them with aggressive bladework. Once the rhythmic, bellowing blasts fade away and the powder dust dissipates, the enemy ship has been taken.
115_pirate_powder_dancer_1.name: Pirate Powder Dancer

115_pirate_powder_dancer_2.description: Powder Dancers are part of a pirate ship’s dedicated boarding crews, agile and tactically versatile fighters and marksmen well versed in the art of ship to ship combat. 116_voracious_mawbloom_1.description: Cultivated by the arcano-botanists of Ferdeaux as befitting guardians for their sprawling topiaries, the carnivorous Mawblooms boast a towering statue, toothed jaw-petals, growth-accelerated root-vines and acidic digestion glands. What started started out as controlled, if experimental, cultivation has spiraled into an ecological disaster, as the Mawblooms evolved an unintended reproducive method by producing so-called Creeplings. The miniature Mawblooms are capable of uprooting themselves and crawl on unnerving root-legs, extending their reach to explore new territories. Their rapid colonization has led to ecological havoc, as they multiply exponentially, choking out native flora and preying upon local fauna.
116_voracious_mawbloom_1.name: Voracious Mawbloom

The miniature Mawblooms are capable of uprooting themselves and crawl on unnerving root-legs, extending their reach to explore new territories. Their rapid colonization has led to ecological havoc, as they multiply exponentially, choking out native flora and preying upon local fauna.
116_voracious_mawbloom_3.name: Voracious Mawbloom

116_mawbloom_creepling_3.description: Creeplings are miniature Mawblooms in an infant stadium. They emerge from underground spawn-pods attached to the Mawbloom’s Graveroots and are the Mawbloom’s primary form of reproduction, attaching to unsuspecting targets to drain them of nutrients, before seeking out new territories to become stationary and grow into Voracious Mawblooms themselves.
116_mawbloom_creepling_3.name: Mawbloom Creepling

000_month_3_draconic_elite_1.description: Draconic Elites are otherworldly might given vaguely humanoid shape, towering man-dragons boasting a scaled hide, reptilian maw and scything talons. Their winged, bipedal grants them total aerial superiority, skilled Elites capable of outmaneuvering even their ancestral patrons. As guardians of ancient ruins, instruments of divine judgment or a greater dragon’s equerry, their presence invokes both fear and reverence, their martial prowess a testament to the potency of this convergence.
000_month_3_draconic_elite_1.name: Draconic Elite

117_skeletal_graveblade_1.description: Graveblades were capable warriors, their body and soul now enthralled by necromancy powerful enough to restore their martial abilities and fighting spirit. Not to be confused with the mindless shambling hordes of lesser undead they often command, they are creative in the way of using their undead form to their advantage, amplifying their martial strength with the possibilities opened up by an undying body. Their fiery passion and warrior’s honour, however, transformed into the cruel coldness of the unliving, turning the Graveblades into relentless executors of calculated and methodical slaughter.
117_skeletal_graveblade_1.name: Skeletal Graveblade

117_skeletal_graveblade_2.description: Graveblades were capable warriors, their body and soul now enthralled by necromancy powerful enough to restore their martial abilities and fighting spirit. 118_cyclops_1.description: Cyclopeans are tragic figurs, once the master smiths of giant kind, using their god-given power over the elements to forge storm-wreathed weaponry for the High Kings of the Storm Giants, the Frost Giant Jarls or Stone Giant Thanes. But these days are over, the few Cyclopeans left are pale shades of former glory, lumbering thin-blooded brutes who barely know how to swing their club, let alone a blacksmith’s hammer. They are very suspicious, but once their mistrust has been overcome, they are trusting bordering gullibe - perhaps an indication that their downfall has been brought about by betrayal and that these wounds still linger.
118_cyclops_1.name: Cyclops

118_cyclops_2.description: Cyclopeans are tragic figurs, once the master smiths of giant kind, using their god-given power over the elements to forge storm-wreathed weaponry for the High Kings of the Storm Giants, the Frost Giant Jarls or Stone Giant Thanes. 119_sand_elemental.description: The four major elemental planes share hidden borders, where their essences intermingle. As looming Magma Elementals populate the vast volcanic trenches below the endless oceans of the aquatic plane, the relentless rasp-winds of the aerial plane instill the terran plane’s sand with life, causing Sand Elementals to rise from the arid dunes, finding their way through weak points of the planar veil into the profane world.
119_sand_elemental.name: Sand Elemental

120_vampire_dreg.description: Dregs are found at the bottom of the vampiric hierarchy, unloved offspring marked and transformed by the bestial nature of their sanguine legacy. They are driven by maddening hunger and the aching need to receive any semblance of acknowledgment from their creator. Once their hunger is satiated, they become even more dangerous, as the starved beast turns into a cunning predator, now pursuing its prey not out of desperation, but for its own debased amusement.
120_vampire_dreg.name: Vampire Dreg

121_sporeshambler_1.description: Sporeshamblers are humanoid husks overtaken by a fungal infestation. These hosts become questing tendrils of the mycotic collective, connected to the greater network in sporular communion. The collective is in a state of continuous adaptation, dissecting every impression felt and every experience gathered by the shambling extensions of its will. Should resistance arise, waves of Sporeshamblers surge against it until the collective has gathered enough information to grow hunter organisms perfectly attuned to the weaknesses of their dedicated prey.
121_sporeshambler_1.name: Sporeshambler

121_sporeshambler_2.description: Sporeshamblers are humanoid husks overtaken by a fungal infestation. These hosts become questing tendrils of the mycotic collective, connected to the greater network in sporular communion. 121_sporeshambler_2.name: Sporeshambler

121_sporeshambler_3.name: Sporeshambler

000_month_5_crownbreaker_archwyvern.description: Crownbreaker Archwyverns are the equivalent of a sentient tornado deciding that it wants to battle the nearest earthquake for catastrophic supremacy. Crownbreakers live to fight for the top of the food chain, tirelessly working their way from territory to territory, domain to domain, tirelessly challenging the rulers of those realms - be they other wyverns, chimeras, giants or even true dragons. Through physical strength, raw aggression, and ceaseless savagery alone, these colossal Arch-Wyverns manage to triumph over opponents that seem many times more powerful than their challengers. With each victory, the Arch-Wyvern emerges stronger, and with each triumph, it comes closer to its goal of absolute martial dominance.
000_month_5_crownbreaker_archwyvern.name: Crownbreaker Archwyvern

122_gutterfist.description: Gutterfists are hard-boiled brawlers, back alley thugs, prizefighters, or gentlemen pugilists. They hold their ground against better-armored foes with nothing but rock-hard abs, moxie, and their bare hands. Eventually, even veteran warriors might find themselves outmaneuvered and pinned to the ground as a hail of fists dents their priceless armor, all while the Gutterfist spouts filthy limericks concerning the promiscuous nature of their opponents’ mothers.
122_gutterfist.name: Gutterfist

123_blackfeather_huntress.description: After the Black Rose Abbey was plundered and put to the torch by a band of roving robber-knights, the Abbess and her sworn sisters turned it into a briar-wreathed bastion and founded the clandestine order of Blackfeather Huntresses, an all female institution of knight-hunters sworn to neither king nor realm. Everyone can petition the Abbey to seek vengeance for unjust transgressions, abuse of power or breaking of chivalrous oaths. If the petition is granted, the Blackfeather Hunt is called and a pair of Huntressess seeks out their knightly prey.
123_blackfeather_huntress.name: Blackfeather Huntress

124_ogre_maneater_1.description: Ogres are gluttonous and vile in nature, wild ogres even more so than their more civilized kin who hire themselves out as extra muscle for legally questionable endeavors. Some Ogres, however, gradually become more debased in their insatiable search for more and more food, eventually becoming dangerous, blood-drunk brutes hellbent on driving their carious tusks into everything they encounter, even taking their attention of ongoing fights to gorge themselves on the fallen combatants - much to the horror of eventual onlookers.
124_ogre_maneater_1.name: Ogre Maneater

124_ogre_maneater_2.description: Ogres are gluttonous and vile in nature, wild ogres even more so than their more civilized kin who hire themselves out as extra muscle for legally questionable endeavors. Some Ogres, however, gradually become more debased in their insatiable search for more and more food, eventually becoming dangerous, blood-drunk brutes hellbent on driving their carious tusks into everything they encounter, even taking their attention of ongoing fights to gorge themselves on the fallen combatants - much to the horror of eventual onlookers.
124_ogre_maneater_2.name: Ogre Maneater

125_satyr_1.description: Satyrs are minor fey who dedicate their lives to the pursuit of pleasure and excess. Due to their natural curiosity, they often find their way into the mundane world through rifts and gaps between planes, where they eagerly interact with its inhabitants. The danger posed by Satyrs is not immediately apparent - their inherent fey magic can plunge mortals into a state of intoxication that leads them to dissolve into a state of hedonistic ecstasy, losing their awareness of place and time before collapsing from exhaustion. Additionally, the satyric temperament can become increasingly unpredictable as the festivities approach their climax, and not infrequently, under the influence of intoxicating substances, the otherwise amicable and sociable creatures reveal their unpredictable and alien fey nature.
125_satyr_1.name: Satyr

125_satyr_2.description: Satyrs are minor fey who dedicate their lives to the pursuit of pleasure and excess. Due to their natural curiosity, they often find their way into the mundane world through rifts and gaps between planes, where they eagerly interact with its inhabitants. The danger posed by Satyrs is not immediately apparent - their inherent fey magic can plunge mortals into a state of intoxication that leads them to dissolve into a state of hedonistic ecstasy, losing their awareness of place and time before collapsing from exhaustion. Additionally, the satyric temperament can become increasingly unpredictable as the festivities approach their climax, and not infrequently, under the influence of intoxicating substances, the otherwise amicable and sociable creatures reveal their unpredictable and alien fey nature.
125_satyr_2.name: Satyr

000_month_6_emissary_of_annihilation.description: The Emissaries of Annihilation are dedicated to the eradication of all life from the universe. They have long abandoned their organic bodies and now act as constructed conduits for an all-annihilating force of non-organic decay. They have created cosmic disciplines that tap into the deconstructive power of complete negation and null-essence to obliterate beings, magic, or even space itself, leaving gaping wounds in reality and motes of dust weightlessly drifting before dispersing, their origin soon to be forgotten by an unfeeling universe.
000_month_6_emissary_of_annihilation.name: Emissary Of Annihilation

126_opulence_devil.description: Opulence Devils revel in subverting mortal structures and corrupting them from within, perhaps even more so than their infernal brethren. Concealed beneath the guise of opulent dignitaries, statesmen or merchant-princes bedecked in jewels, their ostentatious presence screams of extravagance and excess. They entice with promises and bargains, especially those who have little and crave much. Even in combat, these devils seek to tempt their foes, ultimately goading them into their own damnation.
126_opulence_devil.name: Opulence Devil

127_constrictor_drake_1.description: It doesn’t take much imagination to understand why Constrictor Drakes bear their name, as they are the most serpentine of the lesser Wyverns, from their hunting methods to their puff adder-like jaws and tooth shape. They combine the worst qualities of snake and wyverns, resulting in a venomous, choke-happy, flying serpent the size of a horse. The Constrictor Drake’s vivid warning colors only heighten one’s unease because one can only imagine the kind of predator they are trying to deter.
127_constrictor_drake_1.name: Constrictor Drake

127_constrictor_drake_2.description: It doesn’t take much imagination to understand why Constrictor Drakes bear their name, as they are the most serpentine of the lesser Wyverns, from their hunting methods to their puff adder-like jaws and tooth shape. 128_voidmare_wailer.description: Voidmare Wailers hail from the eponymous Voidmare, a nightmarish prison dimension steeped in cosmic darkness. Beings banished into the black cells of the Voidmare lose themselves in isolation and void-chill, eventually pupating and morphing into weeping and wailing monstrosities infused with the dimension’s tortuous, hungering for the dreams and memories of living beings, their own lost forever.
128_voidmare_wailer.name: Voidmare Wailer

000_month_7_azure_dragon_sage.description: Dragon-Sages travel the world, offering their wisdom and experience to those whose philosophies align with their own. Most of them are hundreds of years old, and their gaze discerns patterns and causalities that remain hidden to most. Thus, they assume various roles, from saviors to destroyers, to steer the course of history in a way that aligns with their own nature. Characteristic of Azure Dragon-Sages is the pursuit of freedom for all peoples, and their arrival often heralds revolution and reformation. Some act as advisors, being able to foretel the future by discerning cloud patterns, some as elite instructors or even military leaders, their troops marching to the drum-beat of distant thunder.
000_month_7_azure_dragon_sage.name: Azure Dragon Sage

129_undead_archer_1.description: The legendary Undead Archers of the Burial Host serve as tireless artillery units, inexorable in their mission to provide cover for the marching troops. The Host’s shambling hordes advance through a torrent of Rothail arrows. Even though their deteriorated musculature only allows the use of shortbows, they can be deployed further forward than regular archers, as an undead archer felled by return fire may rise again to continue their ceaseless barrage. Even when outmaneuvered and locked in Melee combat, the Host’s archers refuse to yield, continuing their unrelenting volleys until physically incapable of doing so.
129_undead_archer_1.name: Undead Archer

129_undead_archer_2.description: The legendary Undead Archers of the Burial Host serve as tireless artillery units, inexorable in their mission to provide cover for the marching troops. 130_automaton_enforcer_1.description: Automaton Enforcers represent the culmination of generations of arcane artistry and inventive genius. Hulking avatars of steam and steel, these constructs house arcane reactors capable of producing electrical discharges and executing protocols that mimic cognitive thought. While their utility is hampered by a lack of autonomy and the demands of intricate maintenance, they occasionally find purpose as coveted prestige items among esteemed guild artisans or as experimental support units within forward-thinking security forces.
130_automaton_enforcer_1.name: Automaton Enforcer

130_automaton_enforcer_3.description: Automaton Enforcers represent the culmination of generations of arcane artistry and inventive genius. Hulking avatars of steam and steel, these constructs house arcane reactors capable of producing electrical discharges and executing protocols that mimic cognitive thought. 130_automaton_enforcer_2.name: Automaton Enforcer

131_graftsman_1.description: Graftsmen occupy the lowest caste among the fleshcrafters of the Burial Host. As journeymen that have not yet passed their master’s examination, they don’t have access to the most choice resources from the Host’s Limbchambers, Fleshpits and charnel houses. Instead, they have to scavenge battlefields or undertake personal raids in search of suitable parts for their projects. However, this makes them flexible and pragmatic improvisers who don’t shy away from using less subtle and monstrous grafts, a practice frowned upon in the upper castes. Eager to practice advanced techniques on themselves, they are easily recognizable by their mismatched limbs, hulking statue and gruff demeanor.
131_graftsman_1.name: Graftsman

131_graftsman_2.description: Graftsmen occupy the lowest caste among the fleshcrafters of the Burial Host. 131_graftsman_3.name: Graftsman

132_animated_blade.description: Animated Blades are swords imbued with arcane essence, a semblance of life breathing through them. This phenomenon can occur through enchantment magic, ancient rituals, or more rarely, the awakening of the blade itself. Driven by a deep-seated thirst for combat or an unquenchable desire for revenge, these blades act on their own, no longer requiring a wielder to carry out their intended purpose. Some of these blades are tasked with guarding treasure chambers or wizards’ studies, while others tirelessly roam the the tombs and castles of their long-forgotten masters.
132_animated_blade.name: Animated Blade

133_ratfolk_gutterskulk.description: Wherever damp tunnel networks extend beneath sprawling cities, one can find those who have chosen the Undercity as their domain. Shunned by even the less human-like races due to their unsettling appearance and unsavory reputation, the parallel worlds beneath the great cities are often a realm of matted fur, gnashing teeth, and crooked blades. And if one takes a wrong turn in the tunnels, it’s possible to find themselves confronted by a dozen pairs of yellow-gleaming eyes in the darkness.
133_ratfolk_gutterskulk.name: Ratfolk Gutterskulk

134_rock_golem.description: Hewn from solid rock, these lumbering behemoths lack the sophisticated intricacies of their more contemporary stone or metal counterparts. Instead, they embody the raw essence of ritualistic craftsmanship, of a time when the creation of golems was steeped in mystic rites rather than the precise incantations of modern magical science. The Rock Golem still harbors traces of elemental powers long lost to its more polished successors, echoing the ancient secrets of a lost era.
134_rock_golem.name: Rock Golem

135_skeletal_swashbuckler_1.description: Life at sea is perilous and offers myriad ways to meet an untimely demise — be it disease, violence, or the raw brutality of the elements. Yet, amidst this danger, sailors have discovered diverse means to transcend mortality, seldom by choice. Ancient curses, bonds to captain, crew, and vessel transcending death, or the mystical sway of natural forces all ensure a sailor’s journey sometimes doesn’t conclude with death. The Skeletal Swashbucklers are undead mariners who defy decay, their bleached bones pulsating with a lingering thrill for adventure and peril, refusing to succumb to mere oblivion.
135_skeletal_swashbuckler_1.name: Skeletal Swashbuckler

135_skeletal_swashbuckler_2.description: Life at sea is perilous and offers myriad ways to meet an untimely demise — be it disease, violence, or the raw brutality of the elements. Yet, amidst this danger, sailors have discovered diverse means to transcend mortality, seldom by choice. Ancient curses, bonds to captain, crew, and vessel transcending death, or the mystical sway of natural forces all ensure a sailor’s journey sometimes doesn’t conclude with death. The Skeletal Swashbucklers are undead mariners who defy decay, their bleached bones pulsating with a lingering thrill for adventure and peril, refusing to succumb to mere oblivion.
135_skeletal_swashbuckler_2.name: Skeletal Swashbuckler

000_month_8_lord_of_dust.description: The Ankhir Empire crumbled under the tireless assaults of their unliving former kings and generals, the populace being massacred by those they once worshiped. Soon the numbing desert sand settled on the sunken ruins of sprawling cities, with only the pyramidical god-prisons looming in quiet reminiscence of a cursed realm swallowed by the sand. Woe betide those who stumble upon the ruins of old, cursed Ankh! If roused from their slumber, the forgotten horrors will surely redden the sands once more.
000_month_8_lord_of_dust.name: Lord of Dust

136_tyrannosaurus_rex.description: Amidst the dense, primeval jungles of the Archipelago, lurks a creature whose presence alone invokes visions of primal power—the Tyrannosaurus Rex. Known as the Jungle Monarch in the indigenous xotl language, this colossal predator embodies an ancient and fearsome majesty that evolution wasn’t able to improve upon. Its thunderous footfalls reverberate through the foliage, conjuring images of bygone eras of lost worlds and untamed wilderness. Its towering form and menacing maw evoke the very essence of raw, untamed nature, a prehistoric force that roams the land, instilling a sense of ancient danger and primal instincts in all who dare to wander these unforgiving territories.
136_tyrannosaurus_rex.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex

137_cannonade_crawler_1.description: The Cannonade Crawlers, colossal mega-arthopods renowned for their potent acid bombardments, possess a unique physiology fueled by arcane influences and distinctive biochemical compounds from their diet. They live a symbiotic lifestyle, residing in clusters called regiments, and often engage in battles for other creatures in exchange for sustenance. This mutual relationship has raised questions about a possible feralization from a previously domesticated state. Typically, these agreements involve the Crawlers defending hives, dens, or even villages in exchange for food resources from their employers. This strategic approach secures their survival while allowing them to utilize their specialized defense mechanisms as living artillery.
137_cannonade_crawler_1.name: Cannonade Crawler

000_month_9_forge_devil.description: Forge Devils revel in subjugation, be it the subjugation of elements within their hellish forge complexes, the submission of those who kneel to grasp a morsel of the forbidden arts and infernal intricacies of the Devil’s own craftsmanship, or the subjugation of entire peoples by armies clad in hellforged iron.
000_month_9_forge_devil.name: Forge Devil

138_back_alley_slasher_1.description: Back Alley Slashers are masters of the cobble-plastered underbelly’s unique brand of fighting - swift, dirty bladework. They are quick to anger, seasoned, and ruthless, ever ready to exploit the crooked lanes and nestled alleys of their home city to their advantage. Those who don’t meet their end in their initial conflicts often find their names whispered throughout the gutters, their police records filled with autopsy reports.
138_back_alley_slasher_1.name: Back Alley Slasher

138_back_alley_slasher_2.description: Back Alley Slashers are masters of the cobble-plastered underbelly’s unique brand of fighting - swift, dirty bladework. They are quick to anger, seasoned, and ruthless, ever ready to exploit the crooked lanes and nestled alleys of their home city to their advantage. 138_back_alley_slasher_2.name: Back Alley Slasher

139_witherflesh_ripper.description: At the feet of towering Witherflesh Colossi, swarms of Witherflesh Rippers gather—ravenous undead controllable only through indirect manipulation of their collective swarm-like consciousness. Exposure to large groups of Rippers can transform ordinary undead into Rippers, their physiology swiftly adapting to satisfy the need for tearing and feeding. In regions already wrestling with the presence of undead, these circumstances can lead to additional Ripper epidemics.
139_witherflesh_ripper.name: Witherflesh Ripper

140_samurai_1.description: The Samurai, as a pop cultural icon, embodies honor, discipline, and swordsmanship in the collective imagination. Their significance resonates deeply in various forms of media, painting a picture of skilled warriors, bound by a martial code and pursuing an ideal of unwavering loyalty. The samurai’s lore offers a wealth of themes: loyalty to a lord, a sense of duty, and the pursuit of personal honor. They bring an air of martial prowess and elegance,enhancing the thematic depth of a campaign. The duality of their stoic discipline and the emotional intensity beneath the surface makes them compelling adversaries. Their historical relevance and pop cultural impact make them an excellent choice for challenging and evocative encounters.
140_samurai_1.name: Samurai

000_month_10_skeleton_dragon.description: A dragon’s might appears to be limited only by the constraints of a physical form, forcing it to obey the laws of mortality, as they already ignore those of physics, displaying this particular brand of hybris everytime they take flight. Imagine now this creature no lounger bound to a mortal shell, instead transcending the border between life and death to become something even greater, something even more terrifying. Wreathed in night-coloured soulfire and with a malign spark lightning up its empty eye sockets, a Skeleton Dragon is a draconic nightmare given form, its mere presence draining colour from life and hope from the heart of mortal folk.
000_month_10_skeleton_dragon.name: Skeleton Dragon

141_troll_ironhead.description: Trolls have become increasingly prevalent within gangs, bands, or paramilitary organizations. Those distinguished by exceptional brutality and a spark of intelligence are clad in heavy plate armor and made to believe that nothing can overcome the combination of their thick skulls, natural regeneration, and full plate armor. Their belief in invulnerability renders them dangerously fearless, eagerly throwing themselves into the fray in pursuit of glory and plunder, facing the greatest dangers as waves of enemies crash upon them. However, should their defense be breached, doubts sprout within the troll’s mind, either fermenting into paralyzing fear or boiling over into boundless rage.
141_troll_ironhead.name: Troll Ironhead

142_pyreling.description: Folklore describes Pyrelings as humans who succumbed to volcanic heat or ash smoke, their skeletons enriched with igneous rock and their souls burning with anger caused by their untimely demise. In actuality, Pyrelings are lesser elementals, fire-fickle beings manifesting in places of intense volcanic activity, either to a minor planar convergence or on the behest of greater elemental beings. Pyreling familiars are conceivably very popular among Pyromancers, as they are amicable, if hot-headed and vivacious, undemanding and worthwhile objects of study for those seeking insight into the very nature of fire itself.
142_pyreling.name: Pyreling

143_gnoll_trophy_hunter.description: Gnoll Trophy Hunters start off as typical gnolls, if one could consider a demon-born anthropomorphic hyena to be in any way normal. Some Gnolls display a targeted savagery that surpasses mere hunger; and, under the watchful gaze of their demonic progenitor, they are driven to hunt for increasingly grand prey. Every battle becomes a personal pursuit for trophies, and soon, only the flesh of elite warriors or pack alphas can momentarily sate their all-consuming hunger.
143_gnoll_trophy_hunter.name: Gnoll Trophy Hunter

144_tactician.description: No strategy survives first enemy contact, a statement that is tried and tested. Those taking to the field themselves to make sure that a mind equal to those devising strategy will see it adapted to the flow of the encounter are strategists no longer, but Tacticians. Tutored in all manners of practical warfare by military academies or veterans, these Tacticians are effective force multipliers on the battlefield, assessing threats, relaying immediate orders and acting as the tactical lynchpin for small to medium-scale fighting forces.
144_tactician.name: Tactician

145_ghoul_bonegnawer_1.description: Bone Gnawers are more aggressive and feral than ordinary ghouls. Defying the image of lurking, gaunt and emaciated creatures, they are infused with unnatural strength, pouncing on their victims with unnatural bulk, unsettling body movements, and flesh-hungry savagery. Their grave-cold hands choking the life from their victims, they often start feeding before the last breath is drawn.
145_ghoul_bonegnawer_1.name: Ghoul Bone Gnawer

145_ghoul_bonegnawer_2.description: Bone Gnawers are more aggressive and feral than ordinary ghouls. 146_bard_1.description: Few things are as impactful as music, mere sound touching creatures’ souls, inspiring them, soothing or even frightening them. Within music itself resides an inherent power that can act as a catalyst, unleashing both subtle glamours or earth shattering spells. Not everyone can actively harness this special magic, but those who can, be it through the power of their genius, a grand personality or a deep understanding of the intricacies of the acoustic arcana, possess great power, whether in social situations or on the battlefield.
146_bard_1.name: Bard

146_bard_2.description: Few things are as impactful as music, mere sound touching creatures’ souls, inspiring them, soothing or even frightening them. 000_month_11_mother_base_1.description: Since its inception, various models of the Mobile Operations Transport and Headquarters for Exploration and Reconnaissance Base - or in short Mother Base - serve as a staging post for governmental or private operations, scientific expeditions or incursions into the planar cosmos. Powered by experimental arcane reactors and highly classified clockwork magic, outfitted with different means of environmental traversal and equipped with state of the art weaponry, Mother Base is highly automated and can even act autonomously, lending fire support or tactical assistance to its crew. However, its developers notice with increasing concern that Mother Base units start to develop close bonds with their pilots and crew over time, even behaving irrationally, acting outside of permitted protocol or in other ways considered impossible to protect or even avenge their attached unit.
000_month_11_mother_base_1.name: M.O.T.H.E.R. Base

000_month_11_mother_base_2.description: Since its inception, various models of the Mobile Operations Transport and Headquarters for Exploration and Reconnaissance Base - or in short Mother Base - serve as a staging post for governmental or private operations, scientific expeditions or incursions into the planar cosmos. Powered by experimental arcane reactors and highly classified clockwork magic, outfitted with different means of environmental traversal and equipped with state of the art weaponry, Mother Base is highly automated and can even act autonomously, lending fire support or tactical assistance to its crew. 000_month_11_mother_base_2.name: M.O.T.H.E.R. Base

147_witch_hunter.description: Witch Hunters coordinate the pursuit of magic users who fall outside the accepted framework of arcane arts. This may be related to religious structures, general prejudices, or well-founded fears regarding those who wield such incomprehensible power for many. Witch Hunters must possess strong wills and pursue their mission with nigh-fanatical devotion, otherwise, they can hardly hope to counteract the manifold magical powers with mundane means, be they subtle or obvious. Their work often drives them to the edge of morality and sometimes beyond, and many break under the responsibility that rests on their shoulders - making them particularly dangerous for those who seek to harm no one with their craft but still find themselves in the hunter’s sights.
147_witch_hunter.name: Witch Hunter

148_spore_shepherd_1.description: Spore Shepherds are of tranquil demeanor, tending to the diverse mushroom colonies thriving in their territories, be it long-stalked or wide-capped varieties with wide, delicate fungi or blobs of slime mold. They make no distinction whether their wards are animate, sentient fungi or mundane mushrooms, although outsiders may hardly grasp the intricate mycotic processes and the assessment of fungal sentience. The Shepherds are fiercely protective of their flock and possess extensive mycotic networks, constantly providing them with information about their environment.
148_spore_shepherd_1.name: Spore Shepherd

148_spore_shepherd_2.description: Spore Shepherds are of tranquil demeanor, tending to the diverse mushroom colonies thriving in their territories, be it long-stalked or wide-capped varieties with wide, delicate fungi or blobs of slime mold. 149_gatekeeper_3.description: The role of Gatekeepers is to grant entry and, if necessary, prevent intrusion.  They do this with stoic elegance and an inherent sense of the theatrical demands and expectations of their role. Gatekeepers are the ultimate aesthetic embellishment to any throne room or fortress walkway, poised and ready to cross halberds and stop newcomers dead in their tracks, if only for a thrilling moment of suspense before stepping aside. Gatekeepers are renowned for their patience, their calm demeanor, unwavering loyalty, a flair for the dramatic and of course the combat skills to enforce the implied threat of their presence.
149_gatekeeper_3.name: Gatekeeper

149_gatekeeper_2.description: The role of Gatekeepers is to grant entry and, if necessary, prevent intrusion. 150_ravager_2.description: Ravagers are nigh-legendary warriors whose physical abilities surpass human limits, reaching mythical proportions. Whether living in solitude or leading like minded individuals, their lives are defined by combat, whether born of the harsh circumstances of their origin or by choice. These indomitable warriors have been shaped by years or decades of struggle for survival, their bodies and minds hardened to resist forces that would break lesser beings.
150_ravager_2.name: Ravager

150_ravager_1.description: Ravagers are nigh-legendary warriors whose physical abilities surpass human limits, reaching mythical proportions. Whether living in solitude or leading like minded individuals, their lives are defined by combat, whether born of the harsh circumstances of their origin or by choice. 150_ravager_3.name: Ravager

000_month_12_weavstress.description: The Weavstress is a sinister creature, the extent of its cruel and deceitful nature hidden behind this unassuming title. This colossal arachnid weaves its silvery threads into intricate traps, capable of spinning almost invisible, delicate strands and massive ropes with the strength of steel cables. These threads are soaked in narcotic secretions, inducing hallucinations or narcoleptic episodes. Sleeping creatures are then controlled by the Weavstresses spider-like brood, the Dreamweavers, through narcotic poisons, acting against their will and dancing to the ethereal tunes of the Weavstresses’ haunting song.
000_month_12_weavstress.name: Weavstress

000_month_12_dreamweaver.description: Dreamweavers are the single-minded offspring of the Weavstress. With their oneiric toxins, they are able to manipulate the flow of the Dreamweave, the illusory realm through which the victims of the Weavstress sleepwalk, in order to exert direct control over the behavior of the dreamers.
000_month_12_dreamweaver.name: Dreamweaver

151_dwarven_battlemason.description: Battle-Masons epitomize the convergence of artisanal skill and martial expertise, exemplifying dwarven virtues. Hardened veterans and master craftsmen, they operate and fight in the most adverse conditions, often deployed during sieges or subterranean conflicts. Battle-Masons do not settle for just clearing a tunnel or capturing an enemy position. Materials are reinforced, equipment is set up instantly, and a position is only vacated when it is in better condition than when it was captured. Stern and steadfast, they are the reliable force to turn to in times of crisis, offering expertise in high-pressure environments.
151_dwarven_battlemason.name: Dwarven Battlemason

152_tunnelterror_gorgeworm.description: When a Gorgewormling detects a rich food source or manages to attach unnoticed as a parasite to larger beings, it rapidly grows to immense size. The fully grown Gorgeworm, driven mad by hunger, then burrows through the earth, devouring everything that falls within the reach of its scythe-like mandibles. Though tenacious prey may escape from the worm’s gullet, they are often left with a Broodspawn attached, an undulating egg sac from which the asexually produced offspring of the worm hatch.
152_tunnelterror_gorgeworm.name: Tunnelterror Gorgeworm

152_tunnelterror_gorgewormling.description: When a Gorgewormling detects a rich food source or manages to attach unnoticed as a parasite to larger beings, it rapidly grows to immense size. The fully grown Gorgeworm, driven mad by hunger, then burrows through the earth, devouring everything that falls within the reach of its scythe-like mandibles. Though tenacious prey may escape from the worm’s gullet, they are often left with a Broodspawn attached, an undulating egg sac from which the asexually produced offspring of the worm hatch.
152_tunnelterror_gorgewormling.name: Tunnelterror Gorgewormling

152_tunnelterror_gorgeworm_broodspawn.description: When a Gorgewormling detects a rich food source or manages to attach unnoticed as a parasite to larger beings, it rapidly grows to immense size. 153_mummy_tomb_thrall_1.description: Tomb Thralls were low-ranking devotees who did not necessarily follow their sovereign into death and embalmment willingly. In their current unliving state, their position remains unchanged, rendering them the lowest in hierarchy yet the numerically strongest force, reanimated by the transcendent power of their sovereign, blurring the boundaries between life and death. They serve either to protect their master’s tomb, prepare for his return, or, if he has already risen, to march at the forefront against the living.
153_mummy_tomb_thrall_1.name: Mummy Tomb-Thrall

153_mummy_tomb_thrall_2.description: Tomb Thralls were low-ranking devotees who did not necessarily follow their sovereign into death and embalmment willingly. In their current unliving state, their position remains unchanged, rendering them the lowest in hierarchy yet the numerically strongest force, reanimated by the transcendent power of their sovereign, blurring the boundaries between life and death. They serve either to protect their master’s tomb, prepare for his return, or, if he has already risen, to march at the forefront against the living.
153_mummy_tomb_thrall_2.name: Mummy Tomb-Thrall

154_awakened_armor.description: In a world teeming with dragons, magic, or extraplanar incursions, some hardened adventurers lose respect for the simple dangers of the adventurer’s life. An awakened armor stands as a towering suit of plate mail, devoid of the any weaknesses imposed by organic parts. It feels no pain and knows no mercy; the armor is a tool of overwhelming violence, advancing unstoppably through arrow volleys, hostile terrain or arcane fire.
154_awakened_armor.name: AWakened Armor

155_undead_deplorable.description: Deplorables is a catch-all term for undead creatures barely held together by waning dregs of necromantic energies coursing through their clotted veins. Reduced to decaying husks by ages of service, starvation or especially hostile working conditions, Deplorables make for the bottom tier of undead operatives. But as long as their bones haven‘t been ground to dust and their flesh hasn‘t fully withered, they keep on, shambling, crawling and creeping forwards at the behest of their dark masters, compensating their lack of redeeming qualities with sheer numbers and their indisputable tenacity. Often, these deplorables band together into hordes, descending upon living beings like waves of withered flesh and missing limbs.
155_undead_deplorable.name: Undead Deplorable

155_undead_deplorable_horde.description: Deplorables is a catch-all term for undead creatures barely held together by waning dregs of necromantic energies coursing through their clotted veins. Reduced to decaying husks by ages of service, starvation or especially hostile working conditions, Deplorables make for the bottom tier of undead operatives. But as long as their bones haven‘t been ground to dust and their flesh hasn‘t fully withered, they keep on, shambling, crawling and creeping forwards at the behest of their dark masters, compensating their lack of redeeming qualities with sheer numbers and their indisputable tenacity. Often, these deplorables band together into hordes, descending upon living beings like waves of withered flesh and missing limbs.
155_undead_deplorable_horde.name: Undead Deplorable Horde

000_month_13_chimera.description: Technically, any monstrosity combining the traits of various beasts within a creature is a chimera. But there are instances, where magical happenstance, particularly repulsive instances of procreation or especially ambitious broodmasters create something greater than the sum of its parts, a bestial force driven by a need for domination, channeling the pain and madness coursing through its unnatural body into a destructive force that is terrifying to behold.
000_month_13_chimera.name: Chimera

156_carnax_hatchet_head.description: Carnax Hatchet-Hulks are formidable creatures, scaled behemoths resembling a green-scaled and axe-faced lump of stacked muscle mass moving with harrowing speed and bone-crushing momentum. Despite their ferocity, they are more complex than their bestial appearance and a cursory assessment of their behaviour lets on. It is common for a mature Carnax to seek an equal opponent in battle and, should they prove worthy, submit to them, forming a martial bond in and out of combat, mutually learning from one another as battle brothers, mutuals and mounts. Warriors able to forge such a bond with a Carnax often attain legendary renown, and the power of such a mighty ally often allows them to naturally or violently rise to the top of their respective hierarchical structures.
156_carnax_hatchet_head.name: Carnax Hatchet-Hulk

047_swifttalon_raptor_2.description: Lightning fast, agile and deadly - Swifttalon Raptors showcase peak evolutionary efficiency. They hunt in small packs, stalking and outmaneuvering prey much larger than themselves. When the Raptors have their prey encircled, they first attack in waves, probing their quarry’s defenses and opening up gashing wounds with their crooked talons. Lastly they overwhelm with numbers, bearing down on their exhausted prey in a surge of scales, teeth and claws.
047_swifttalon_raptor_2.name: Swifttalon Raptor

047_swifttalon_raptor_3.description: Lightning fast, agile and deadly - Swifttalon Raptors showcase peak evolutionary efficiency. They hunt in small packs, stalking and outmaneuvering prey much larger than themselves. When the Raptors have their prey encircled, they first attack in waves, probing their quarry’s defenses and opening up gashing wounds with their crooked talons. Lastly they overwhelm with numbers, bearing down on their exhausted prey in a surge of scales, teeth and claws.
047_swifttalon_raptor_3.name: Swifttalon Raptor

157_infernal_infanterist_1.description: Untold legions of lesser devils form the bulk of the infernal armies, born from soot, sulfur, and sin. Automatically under the command of the ruler whose domain they manifest in, they themselves have only minimal agendas, their emotional spectrum reduced to those traits necessary to wage war at their leader’s behest. Yet, over the course of their service, they may gain power and consciousness, perhaps even managing to distinguish themselves among their peers and begin their ascent through the ranks of the hellish legions.
157_infernal_infanterist_1.name: Infernal Infanterist

157_infernal_infanterist_2.description: Untold legions of lesser devils form the bulk of the infernal armies, born from soot, sulfur, and sin. Automatically under the command of the ruler whose domain they manifest in, they themselves have only minimal agendas, their emotional spectrum reduced to those traits necessary to wage war at their leader’s behest. Yet, over the course of their service, they may gain power and consciousness, perhaps even managing to distinguish themselves among their peers and begin their ascent through the ranks of the hellish legions.
157_infernal_infanterist_2.name: Infernal Infanterist

157_infernal_infanterist_3.description: Untold legions of lesser devils form the bulk of the infernal armies, born from soot, sulfur, and sin. 157_infernal_infanterist_3.name: Infernal Infanterist

158_infernal_immolator_1.description: Within the infernal realms, some factions of devils actively contemplate their roles in the construct of sin, punishment, and atonement. They are dismissed by the more straightforward fiends as esoterics, yet bloody wars have been fought over interpretations of infernal nature. Immolators belong to the more radical factions of these mystic covens, firmly convinced of their role as harbingers of the punishing, all-consuming fire. Surrounded by an ominous calm, they readily join infernal hosts as independent actors, and no sin escapes their sixfold gaze.
158_infernal_immolator_1.name: Infernal Immolator

016_lone_wolf.description: For all their might, wolf packs live dangerous lives on a knife’s edge. Bad weather, lack of food or the confrontation with a superior opponent can spell certain death for a whole pack. And even those who narrowly escape death may succumb to the hardships of the wilderness. But some adapt to a life of solitude. Their constant fight for survival shapes them to be more ferocious in combat and forces them to rely on their keen senses even more. They develop a sharper instinct for survival and become more cunning than their pack-hunting kin, often stalking their chosen prey for days before deciding on the ideal moment to strike.
016_lone_wolf.name: Lone Wolf

016_wolf_1.description: Wolves are natures way of reminding humans that their superiority extends only as far as their city walls. Those who still venture forth into the frontiers are wise to fear the wolf, the grey-haired and yellow-eyed incarnation of the hunt. Many tribal cultures worship the wolf as totem animals, venerating them as bringers of swift death and cunning hunters, as well as symbols of unity and cohesion.
016_wolf_1.name: Wolf

016_wolfkin.description: Those afflicted by the Curse of the Wulfen slowly lose themselves to the bestial urges festering within their soul. After each hunt it gets harder to take on human form and even the horrid shape of the man-wolf becomes difficult to maintain. Soon the Wolfkin have all but forgotten what it means to be human and fully dedicate themselves to the hunt. Bigger, stronger and blessed with a remaining spark of malicious intellect, Wolfkin soon find themselves in charge of a pack of regular wolves, often answering the call of other hunting Wulfen, eager to redden their maw in the ensuing bloodbath.
016_wolfkin.name: Wolfkin

016_wolf_2.description: Wolves are natures way of reminding humans that their superiority extends only as far as their city walls. 016_wolf_2.name: Wolf

159_vampire_chiropterror_1.description: Some Vampires attain the ability to tap deeply into the bestial aspect of their tainted blood, enabling them to assume a monstrous form alongside their humanoid guise. One such manifestation is the Chiropterror, bat-like brutes with innate mastery over sanguine biomancy, capable of enhancing their already considerable strength and speed through blood magic to truly terrifying heights. While some Vampires can transition between their charming, humanoid form and this monstrous one, others succumb to the call of the hunt, causing their outward appearance to truly mirror the beast within.
159_vampire_chiropterror_1.name: Vampire Chiropterror

159_vampire_chiropterror_2.description: Some Vampires attain the ability to tap deeply into the bestial aspect of their tainted blood, enabling them to assume a monstrous form alongside their humanoid guise. 000_month_14_dwarven_battlebrewer.description: Brewing is more than just a craft for dwarves; it’s a cultural cornerstone deeply intertwined with the local identity of their decentralized and often isolated societies. Each mountain kingdom or cavernous realm, has their unique brews enriched with customs and culture. Whether it’s hearty whiskey with hints of volcanic smoke, clear schnapps with sparkling mineral particles, or strong beer brewed from underground river water, they all have the power to soothe weary hands and quickly loosen knotted muscles. With their potent brews, Battle-Brewers specialize in maintaining the esprit de corps and, with their down-to-earth and jovial nature, they ease the hardships of military life, all while never hesitating to get their hands dirty themselves.
000_month_14_dwarven_battlebrewer.name: month 14 Dwarven Battlebrewer

000_month_14_dwarven_brewers_boarcart.description: Traditionally, the Battle-Brewers carts are pulled by mighty boars, serving both as beasts of burden and defenders of the Brewer’s mobile tavern and improvised brewery. These boars are nurtured from birth and raised on a secret diet, likely involving copious amounts of dwarven spirits, to enhance their already considerable combat prowess.
000_month_14_dwarven_brewers_boarcart.name: month 14 Dwarven Brewers Boarcart

000_month_14_giant_boar.description: Countless royal hunting expeditions have been thrown into disarray by the ferocity of a single regular boar, leaving a trail of hunters scarred by their encounters - not all living to tell the tale. Giants among their already towering kind, giant boars dwarf their ordinary brethren, doubling in stature and quadrupling in mass. When a rampaging giant boar charges, conventional methods falter, and its onslaught often rivals the devastation normally reserved for natural disasters.
000_month_14_giant_boar.name: month 14 Giant Boar
